00028 #include <string.h>   /* for strchr() */
00029 #include <stdio.h>    /* for fprintf() */
00030 #include <fcntl.h>    /* for open() */
00031 #include <unistd.h>   /* for close() */
00032 #include <errno.h>    /* for errno() */
00033 #include <sys/stat.h> /* for stat() */
00034 #include <time.h>     /* for time() */
00035 
00036 #include <stdarg.h>
00037 #include <syslog.h>
00038 #include "comm.h"
00039 #include "utils.h"
00040 #include "log.h"
00041 
00042 static FILE *log;
00043 
00047 void
00048 log_init (const char *filename)
00049 {
00050   if ((!filename) || (!strcmp (filename, "stderr")))
00051     {
00052       log = stderr;
00053       dup2 (2, 3);
00054     }
00055   else if (!strcmp (filename, "syslog"))
00056     {
00057       openlog ("openvassd", 0, LOG_DAEMON);
00058       log = NULL;
00059     }
00060 
00061   else
00062     {
00063       int fd = open (filename, O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_APPEND, 0644);
00064       if (fd < 0)
00065         {
00066           fprintf (stderr, "log_init():open : %s\n", strerror (errno));
00067           fprintf (stderr, "Could not open the logfile, using stderr\n");
00068           log = stderr;
00069         }
00070 
00071       if (fd != 3)
00072         {
00073           if (dup2 (fd, 3) < 0)
00074             {
00075               perror ("dup2 ");
00076             }
00077           close (fd);
00078         }
00079 
00080       log = fdopen (3, "a");
00081       if (log == NULL)
00082         {
00083           perror ("fdopen ");
00084           log = stderr;
00085           dup2 (2, 3);
00086         }
00087 
00088       setlinebuf (log);
00089     }
00090 }
00091 
00092 
00093 
00094 void
00095 log_close ()
00096 {
00097   if (log != NULL)
00098     {
00099       log_write ("closing logfile");
00100       fclose (log);
00101       log = NULL;
00102     }
00103   else
00104     closelog ();
00105 }
00106 
00107 
00108 /*
00109  * write into the logfile using a va_list.
00110  * Nothing fancy here...
00111  */
00112 void
00113 log_vwrite (const char *str, va_list arg_ptr)
00114 {
00115   char disp[4096];
00116   char *tmp;
00117 
00118   vsnprintf (disp, sizeof (disp), str, arg_ptr);
00119 
00120   tmp = disp;
00121   while ((tmp = (char *) strchr (tmp, '\n')) != NULL)
00122     tmp[0] = ' ';
00123 
00124 
00125   if (log != NULL)
00126     {
00127       char timestr[255];
00128       time_t t;
00129 
00130       t = time (NULL);
00131       tmp = ctime (&t);
00132 
00133       timestr[sizeof (timestr) - 1] = '\0';
00134       strncpy (timestr, tmp, sizeof (timestr) - 1);
00135       timestr[strlen (timestr) - 1] = '\0';
00136       fprintf (log, "[%s][%d] %s\n", timestr, getpid (), disp);
00137     }
00138   else
00139     syslog (LOG_NOTICE, "%s", disp);
00140 }
00141 
00142 /*
00143  * write into the logfile
00144  * Nothing fancy here...
00145  */
00146 void
00147 log_write (const char *str, ...)
00148 {
00149   va_list param;
00150 
00151   va_start (param, str);
00152   log_vwrite (str, param);
00153   va_end (param);
00154 }
